Oracles can be your best friend, they will decrypt anything, except the flag's ciphertext. How will you break it? Connect with `nc mercury.picoctf.net 60368`.

Hints:
1. What can you do with a different pair of ciphertext and plaintext? What if it is not so different after all...

## SoluciÃ³n

``` python
>>> n = 
>>> e = 65537
>>> c = 
>>> x = pow(2,e,n)
>>> c * x

>>> m = 580550060391700078946913236734911770139931497702556153513487440893406629034802718534645538074938502890769138695361576199930 // 2
>>> from Crypto.Util.number import long_to_bytes
>>> long_to_bytes(m)
b'picoCTF{m4yb3_Th0se_m3s54g3s_4r3_difurrent_3279013}'

```

Notas:
c = texto cifrdo
m = mensaje de texto plan
p = numero primo
q = numero primo
n = modulo
tn = totient n
e = exponente (llave publica) = 65537
d = llave privada

n = p * q
tn = (p-1) * (q-1)
d = e mod inv tn

Encriptar: python pow(m,e,n)
c = m ^ e mod n

Desencriptar: pow(c,d,n)
m = c ^ d mod n

**Homomorfico:
encriptar(m1)  x encriptar(m2)  x encriptar(m1xm2)**
